intro: Galium microcarpon, commonly known as littlewhisker or dwarf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium microcarpon is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
